verb.description: Look at someone or something with one or both eyes partly closed in an attempt to see more clearly or as a reaction to strong light.
examples: the bright sun made them squint

verb.description: Have eyes that look in different directions.

noun.description: A permanent deviation in the direction of the gaze of one eye.
An oblique opening through a wall in a church permitting a view of the altar from an aisle or side chapel.

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense squinting, as in squint-eyed): shortening of asquint.
